5.1: Therefore be imitators of God, as dearly loved children.
5.2: And walk in love, as also Christ loved us and gave himself up for us, a fragrant offering and sacrifice to God.
5.3: But there must not be even a suggestion among you of sexual immorality or any kind of impurity or of greed, for these are improper for God's holy people.
5.4: Let there be no filthiness, no foolish talk, and no crude jokes—all of which are improper. Instead there should be thanksgiving.
5.5: For you can be sure of this, that no sexually immoral, impure, or greedy person—that is, an idolater—has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.
5.6: Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the anger of God is coming upon the sons of disobedience.
5.7: Therefore, do not join in with them.
5.8: For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light,
5.9: (for the fruit of the light consists in all goodness, righteousness, and truth)
5.10: and find out what is pleasing to the Lord.
5.11: Do not associate with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather expose them.
5.12: For it is shameful even to mention the things they do in secret.
5.13: But when anything is illuminated by the light, it becomes visible.

and arise from the dead ones,
and Christ will shine on you."
5.15: Look carefully how you live—not as unwise but as wise.
5.16: Redeem the time because the days are evil.
5.17: Therefore, do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
5.18: And do not get drunk with wine, for that leads to reckless behavior. Instead, be filled with the Holy Spirit,
5.19: speaking to each other in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody to the Lord with all your heart,
5.20: always giving thanks for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God the Father,
5.21: submitting yourselves to one another in reverence for Christ.
5.22: Wives, submit to your husbands, as to the Lord.
5.23: For the husband is the head of the wife as Christ also is the head of the church, and Christ himself is its savior.
5.24: But as the church submits to Christ, so also wives must submit to their husbands in everything.
5.25: Husbands, love your wives, as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.
5.26: Christ gave himself for the church so that he might make her holy, having cleansed her by the washing of water with the word,
5.27: so that he might present her to himself as glorious, without stain or wrinkle or any such thing, but holy and without fault.
5.28: In the same way husbands ought to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself.
5.29: For no one ever hated his own body, but nourishes and treats it with care, just as Christ nourishes and treats the church with care,
5.30: because we are members of his body.
5.31: "For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and will be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh."
5.32: This hidden truth is great—but I am speaking about Christ and the church.
5.33: Nevertheless, each of you also must love his own wife as himself, and the wife must respect her husband.
